channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-10728] deprecate unix_timestamp(void) and make it deterministic
item.description:
We have a proper current_timestamp function that is not evaluated at runtime.
Behavior of unix_timestamp(void) is both surprising, and is preventing some optimizations on the other overload since the function becomes non-deterministic.
item.summary: deprecate unix_timestamp(void) and make it deterministic

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12733642 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
If I am reading this right, this is not deprecating unix_timestamp() but is throwing exception. That will be backward-incompatible, no ?
Yes... I don't know any other way to deprecate UDFs
ashutoshc ping?
I will let gates comment on whats the policy for deprecating udfs. Throwing exception as you have done I see breaks backward compatibility.

gates can you comment?
The other way would be to rewrite the (void) overload to act like current_timestamp, that way both would be deterministic.
Given that it wasn't deterministic in the first place, returning same value is a compatible behavior
Updated accordingly

ATTACHMENT ID: 12736290 - PreCommit-HIVE-TRUNK-Build
ashutoshc ping?

This is change in behavior of existing functionality. e.g, where c1 > unix_timestamp() will give you different resultset depending on values of c1, before and after this patch on same table.
I want to hear other committer's comment whether this is kosher to do this or not. gates What do you think?

At the very least, this seems to fall into the category of something you want to commit on trunk and not on branch-1.

At the very least, this seems to fall into the category of something you want to commit on trunk and not on branch-1.

+1, as this is a definite backwards incompatible change.

unix_timestamp/0 is non-deterministic, so different results are by design.
In existing code, results will be different depending on whether task fails or not, for example (retrying will create different timestamp).
So it's not a backward incompatible change
committed to trunk. Thanks!

Doc note: Adding a TODOC1.3 label. Document this in the Date Functions section of UDFs.

  • Hive Operators and UDFs – Date Functions
